carts.name: House
carts.description: Nestled deep in the forest, this charming house blends seamlessly with its surroundings.

carts.name: Big Ben
carts.description: Big Ben is the Great Bell of the clock at the Palace of Westminster. Completed in 1859, it stands 316 feet tall and is a symbol of the UK, known for its distinctive chimes.

carts.name: Statue of Liberty
carts.description: The Statue of Liberty, a gift from France in 1886, stands on Liberty Island in New York Harbor. It symbolizes freedom and democracy, featuring a robed figure holding a torch.

carts.name: Niagara falls
carts.description: Niagara Falls is a major natural attraction on the U.S.-Canada border, featuring three powerful waterfalls: Horseshoe Falls, American Falls, and Bridal Veil Falls.

carts.name: Eiffel tower
carts.description: The Eiffel Tower, completed in 1889, is a wrought-iron landmark in Paris, known for its distinctive design and stunning city views.

carts.name: Sydney Opera House
carts.description: The Sydney Opera House is an iconic performing arts center in Sydney, Australia, known for its distinctive sail-like design and stunning harbor views.

carts.name: Taj Mahal
carts.description: The Taj Mahal is a stunning white marble mausoleum in Agra, India, built by Emperor Shah Jahan in the 17th century in memory of his wife Mumtaz Mahal.

carts.name: Giraffe
carts.description: A giraffe is a tall African mammal known for its long neck, legs, and distinctive spotted coat. It is the tallest land animal and primarily feeds on leaves from trees.

carts.name: White bear
carts.description: A polar bear is a large white bear native to the Arctic, known for its thick fur and ability to swim long distances. It primarily hunts seals and is well adapted to cold environments.

carts.name: Hawai
carts.description: Hawaii is a U.S. state located in the central Pacific Ocean, known for its beautiful beaches, volcanic landscapes, and diverse culture. It consists of an archipelago of islands, with Honolulu on Oahu being the state capital.

carts.name: Great Wall of China
carts.description: The Great Wall of China is an extensive series of fortifications made of various materials, stretching over 13,000 miles. Built to protect against invasions, it is one of the most impressive architectural feats in history.

carts.name: City
carts.description: A city is a large, densely populated urban area with complex infrastructure, including buildings, roads, and services. It serves as a hub for commerce, culture, and governance.

carts.name: Desert
carts.description: A desert is a barren, arid region with minimal vegetation and low precipitation. It often features sand dunes, rocky landscapes, and extreme temperature variations.

carts.name: Farm
carts.description: A farm is a tract of land used for growing crops and raising animals. It includes buildings and equipment necessary for agricultural activities, such as fields, barns, and silos.

carts.name: Forest
carts.description: A winter forest is a wooded area covered in snow and ice, with bare trees and a quiet, serene atmosphere. It features a stark, tranquil beauty, often with frosted branches and a blanket of snow on the ground.
